metadata.title: CVE-2023-7042 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A null pointer dereference vulnerability was found inath10k_wmi_tlv_op_pull_mgmt_tx_compl_ev() indrivers/net/wireless/ath/ath10k/wmi-tlv.c in the Linux kernel. This issuecould be exploited to trigger a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-7042` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
